ArabicTitle: مِنْ سِفْرِ أَيُّوبَ الْصِدِّيق بَرَكَتُهُ الْمُقَدَّسَةُ فَلْتَكُنْ مَعَنَا . آمِينْ . ( ۳۸ : ۳۷ - ۱:۳۹- ۳۰ )

Hymn.Arabic: مَنْ يُحْصِي الْغُيُومَ بِحِكْمَتِهِ ؟ وَمَنْ يَسْكُبُ زِقَاقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ ،
Hymn.English: 37 Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can pour out the bottles of heaven,

Hymn.Arabic: إِذْ يَتَلَبَّدُ التُّرَابُ وَيَتَلَاصَقُ الْمَدَرُ (الطين) ؟
Hymn.English: 38 When the dust hardens in clumps, And the clods cling together?

Hymn.Arabic: أَتَصْطَادُ لِلَّبُؤةِ فَرِيسَتَهَا ، وَتُشْبِعُ نُفُوسَ أَشبَالِهَا ،
Hymn.English: 39 Can you hunt the prey for the lion, Or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,

Hymn.Arabic: حِينَ تُرْبِضُ فِي الْعَرَائِنِ وَتَقْعُدُ فِي أَجَمَتِهَا (غابتها) كَامِنَةً؟
Hymn.English: 40 When they crouch in their dens, Or lurk in their lairs to lie in wait?

Hymn.Arabic: مَنْ يَرْزُقُ الْغُرَابَ صَيْدَهُ ، إِذْ تَنْعَبُ فِرَاخُهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ ، وَتَهِيمُ لِعَوزِ الْقُوتِ ؟
Hymn.English: 41 Who provides food for the raven, When its young ones cry to God, And wander about for lack of food?

Hymn.Arabic: هَلْ عَلِمْتَ مَتَى تَلِدُ أَوْعَالُ الصُّخُورِ. أَمْ رَقَبْتَ نَتَاجَ الْأَيَائِلِ ؟
Hymn.English: 39:1 Do you know the time when the wild mountain goats bear young? Or can you mark when the deer gives birth?

Hymn.Arabic: هَلْ حَسَبْتَ أَشْهُرَ حَمْلِهُنَّ ، وَعَلِمْتَ أَوَانَ وَضْعِهُنَّ ؟
Hymn.English: 2 Can you number the months that they fulfill? Or do you know the time when they bear young?

Hymn.Arabic: يَبْرُكْنَ وَيَضَعْنَ أَوْلَادَهُنَّ وَيَدْفَعْنَ مَخَاصَهُنَّ .
Hymn.English: 3 They bow down, They bring forth their young, They deliver their offspring.

Hymn.Arabic: ثُمَّ تَكْبَرُ أَوْلَادُهُنَّ وَتُرَبَّى فِي الْبَرِّ. تَخْرُجُ وَلَا تَعُودُ إلَيْهِنَّ
Hymn.English: 4 Their young ones are healthy, They grow strong with grain; They depart and do not return to them.

Hymn.Arabic: مَنْ أَطْلَقَ سَرَاحَ الْفَرَاءِ ، وَمَنْ حَلَّ وُثْقَ حِمَارِ الْوَحْشِ ؟
Hymn.English: 5 Who set the wild donkey free? Who loosed the bonds of the onager,

Hymn.Arabic: جَعَلْتُ الصَّحْرَاءَ بَيْتَهُ وَالسِّبَاخَ مَسَاكِنَهُ.
Hymn.English: 6 Whose home I have made the wilderness, And the barren land his dwelling?

Hymn.Arabic: يَضْحَكُ عَلَى جَلَبَةِ الْمُدُنِ. وَلَا يَسْمَعُ زَجْرَ الْمُسَخِّرِ.
Hymn.English: 7 He scorns the tumult of the city; He does not heed the shouts of the driver.

Hymn.Arabic: دَائِرَةُ الْجِبَالِ مَرْعَاهُ ، وَعَلَى كُلِّ خُضْرَةٍ يُفَتِّشُ.
Hymn.English: 8 The range of the mountains is his pasture, And he searches after every green thing.

Hymn.Arabic: أَيَرْضَى الثَّوْرُ الْوَحْشِيُّ أَنْ يَخْدُمَكَ ، أَمْ يَبيتُ عِنْدَ مَعْلَفِكَ ؟
Hymn.English: 9 Will the wild ox be willing to serve you? Will he bed by your manger?

Hymn.Arabic: أَتَرْبِطُ الثَّوْرَ الْوَحْشِيَّ بِربَاطِهِ فِي خَطِ الْمِحْرَاثِ ، أَمْ يُمَهِّدُ الأَوْدِيَةَ وَرَاءَكَ ؟
Hymn.English: 10 Can you bind the wild ox in the furrow with ropes? Or will he plow the valleys behind you?

Hymn.Arabic: أَتَتَّكِلُ عَلَى قُوَّتِهِ الْعَظِيمَةِ ، وَتُفَوِّضُ إِلَيْهِ أَعْمَالَكَ ؟
Hymn.English: 11 Will you trust him because his strength is great? Or will you leave your labor to him?

Hymn.Arabic: أَتَأْتَمِنُهُ أَنْ يَسْتَغِلَّ مَا زَرَعْتَ وَيَجْمَعُ بَيْدَرَكَ ؟
Hymn.English: 12 Will you trust him to bring home your grain, And gather it to your threshing floor?

Hymn.Arabic: أَجَناحُ النَّعَامَةِ الْمُرَفْرِفُ مِثلُ جَناحَ اللَّقْلَقِ أَوْ الْبَازِي ؟
Hymn.English: 13 The wings of the ostrich wave proudly, But are her wings and pinions like the kindly stork's?

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِنَّهَا تَتْرُكُ بَيْضَهَا عَلَى الْأَرْضِ وَتَحْضُنُهُ عَلَى التُّرَابِ.
Hymn.English: 14 For she leaves her eggs on the ground, And warms them in the dust;

Hymn.Arabic: وَتَنْسَى أَنَّ الرِّجلَ تَطَأَهُ ، وَأَنَّ وَحْشَ الصَّحْرَاءِ يَشْدَخُهُ.
Hymn.English: 15 She forgets that a foot may crush them, Or that a wild beast may break them.

Hymn.Arabic: تَقْسُو عَلَى أَوْلَادِهَا كَأَنَّهَا لَيْسَتْ لَهَا , فَيَضِيعُ تَعَبُهَا بِلَا أَسَفٍ ،
Hymn.English: 16 She treats her young harshly, as though they were not hers; Her labor is in vain, without concern,

Hymn.Arabic: لِأَنَّ اللَّهَ أَذْهَبَ عَنْهَا الْحِكْمَةَ ، وَلَمْ يَرْزُقُهَا الْفَهْمَ
Hymn.English: 17 Because God deprived her of wisdom, And did not endow her with understanding.

Hymn.Arabic: لَكِنْ إِذَا خَفَقَتْ بِجَنَاحَيْهَا إِلَى الْعَلُوِّ ، تَضْحَكُ عَلَى الْفَرَسِ وَرَاكِبِهِ.
Hymn.English: 18 When she lifts herself on high, She scorns the horse and its rider.

Hymn.Arabic: أَأَنْتَ الَّذِي يُؤْتِي الْفَرَسَ قُوَّةً ، وَيُقَلِّدُ عُنُقَهُ رَعْدًا ،
Hymn.English: 19 Have you given the horse strength? Have you clothed his neck with thunder?

Hymn.Arabic: وَيُوثِبُهُ كَالْجَرَادِ ؟ إِنَّ نَفْخَ نَخِيرِهِ هَائِلٌ
Hymn.English: 20 Can you frighten him like a locust? His majestic snorting strikes terror.

Hymn.Arabic: يَبْحَثُ فِي الْوَادِي وَيَمْرَحُ نَشَاطًا. وَيَقْتَحِمُ لِلقَاءِ السَّلَاحِ
Hymn.English: 21 He paws in the valley, and rejoices in his strength; He gallops into the clash of arms.

Hymn.Arabic: يَضْحَكُ عَلَى الْخَوْفِ وَلَا يَرْهَبُ ، وَلَا يَنْهَزِمُ مِنَ السَّيْفِ .
Hymn.English: 22 He mocks at fear, and is not frightened; Nor does he turn back from the sword.

Hymn.Arabic: تُصَلْصِلُ عَلَيْهِ السَّهَامُ وَسِنَانُ الرُّمْحِ وَالْمِزْرَاقِ.
Hymn.English: 23 The quiver rattles against him, The glittering spear and javelin.

Hymn.Arabic: فِي هَيَجَانِهِ وَرِجْزِهِ يَلْتَهِمُ الْأَرْضَ ، وَلَا يُصَدِّقُ أَنْ يَهْتِفَ الْبُوقُ.
Hymn.English: 24 He devours the distance with fierceness and rage; Nor does he come to a halt because the trumpet has sounded.

Hymn.Arabic: إِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الْبُوقِ يَقُولُ : هَا ! وَيَسْتَرُوِحُ الْقِتَالَ عَنْ بُعْدِ وَصِيَاحَ الْقُوَّادِ وَالْهُتَافَ.
Hymn.English: 25 At the blast of the trumpet he says, `Aha!' He smells the battle from afar, The thunder of captains and shouting.

Hymn.Arabic: أَبِحِكْمَتِكَ يَسْتَقِلُّ الْبَازِي (نوع من الصقور) فِي الْجَوِّ وَيَبْسُطُ جَنَاحَيْهِ نَحْوَ الْجَنُوبِ ؟
Hymn.English: 26 Does the hawk fly by your wisdom, And spread its wings toward the south?

Hymn.Arabic: أَمْ بِأَمْرِكَ يُحَلِّقُ النَّسْرُ وَيَجْعَلُ وَكَرَهُ فِي الْعَلَاءِ؟
Hymn.English: 27 Does the eagle mount up at your command, And make its nest on high?

Hymn.Arabic: مَسْكَنُهُ الصَّخْرُ وَفِيهِ مَبِيتُهُ وَعَلَى أَنْفِ الصَّخْرِ مَعْقِلُهُ
Hymn.English: 28 On the rocks it dwells and resides, On the crag of the rock and the stronghold.

Hymn.Arabic: مِنْ هُنَاكَ يَبْحَثُ عَنْ قُوتِهِ. وَعَيْنَاهُ تَنْظُرَانِ إِلَى بَعِيدٍ
Hymn.English: 29 From there it spies out the prey; Its eyes observe from afar.

Hymn.Arabic: فِرَاخُهُ تَعُبُّ الدِّمَاءَ ، وَحَيْثُمَا كَانَتِ الْقَتْلَى فَهُنَاكَ يَكُونُ
Hymn.English: 30 Its young ones suck up blood; And where the slain are, there it is.
